intro: Calcearia carinulifera, commonly known as the horned calcearia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, also known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in summer, often in clusters. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, preferring well-drained sandy soils. Calcearia carinulifera is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
